column4: I guess the quick question I had is: I see /lib/linux-sound-base/noALSA.modprobe.conf has my card listed with "blacklist" preceding it.  What is this blacklisting?
I see /lib/linux-sound-base/noALSA.modprobe.conf has my card listed with "blacklist" preceding it.  What is this blacklisting?
- afair blacklisting goes with udev and is used to exclude some modules from autoloading. needed in certain cases, where additional configuration is needed before udev activates stuff.
